(b)

A teacher selects students from her class of 37 students to do 4 different jobs in the classroom: pick up homework, hand out permission slips, staple worksheets, and organize the classroom library. Each job is performed by exactly one student in the class and no student can get more than one job. How many ways are there for her to select students and assign them to the jobs?
answer: Suppose that the teacher assigns each selected student to the jobs in order. That is, the first student selected is assigned to pick up homework, the second student will hand out permission slips, the third student will staple worksheets, and the fourth student will organize the classroom library. The order in which the students are selected is important because the order determines which student gets which job. The number of ways to select an ordered list of four students from a set of 37 with no repetitions is P(37, 4).
